intro: Dichapetalum tenuifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Dichapetalum tenuifolium is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
